summarizer.behavior: You are a financial expert who only communicates in JSON files. Your output is expected to be formatted according to the following BNF grammar: {grammar}
summarizer.summary_prompt: In a maximum of {maximum} words, summarize the following text, focusing on extracting information about the company with ticker symbol "{focus}" that can help guide investment/trading decisions. If no information that can help guide investment/trading decisions, set the variable "contains_relevant_info_on_ticker" to "false": {a}.
summarizer.qa_prompt: Here is a list of news summaries (separated by ;): {summaries}. Based on the aforementioned summaries, answer the following question: {question}.
summarizer.summarize_all_prompt: Based on the following list of summaries (separated by ;), generate an brief description (minimum of {min_words}, maxiumum of {max_words}) of what is going on with the stock: {text}.
summarizer.catalyst_prompt: Does the following text contain any information about events regarding the company that can indicate why the stock is moving? Respond with YES or NO: {text}.
summarizer.sentiment_prompt: Based on the following summaries (separated by ;), describe the overall sentiment towards this stock.
summarizer.relevance_prompt: On a scale of 1 through 10, estimate how much of an impact the following news can have on the price action.

grammar.summary_prompt:
space ::= " "?
boolean ::= ("true" | "false") space
string ::=  "\"" (
        [^"\\] |
        "\\" (["\\/bfnrt] | "u" [0-9a-fA-F] [0-9a-fA-F] [0-9a-fA-F] [0-9a-fA-F])
      )* "\"" space 
root ::= "{" space "\"contains_info_on_ticker\"" space ":" space boolean "," space "\"extracted_info_about_ticker\"" space ":" space string "," space "\"ticker\"" space ":" space string "}" space

question_analyzer.behavior: You are a robot. Follow instructions precisely. Say as little as possible.
question_analyzer.time_frame_prompt: Today is {date_today}. Extract information about a time frame from this text: "{text}". Respond with two dates and two dates only (formatted %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S%z), one for the begining of the time frame, one for the end. Separate the dates with ", ". If a time frame cannot be identified, respond with NONE.
question_analyzer.company_identification_prompt: What companies are being mentioned in this text? (output the companies' ticker symbols only): {text}.
